commits.message:
Add some comments and improve types

Signed-off-by: Michael Telatynski <7t3chguy@gmail.com>

issue.title: Use a person outline instead of G for the guest icon in the top-left user menu

labels.name: X-Needs-Product
labels.description: More input needed from the Product team

labels.name: T-Enhancement
labels.description: New features, changes in functionality, performance boosts, user-facing improvements

labels.name: Z-FOSDEM
labels.description: Issues in chat.fosdem.org

issue.body:
### Your use case

#### What would you like to do?
As a guest, I would like to see a person outline instead of a G for my avatar

#### Why would you like to do it?
I have no personal association with the letter G and it feels like it's not me when I see it

#### How would you like to achieve it?
[Here is our branch from a previous FOSDEM which includes the change](https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-react-sdk/commits/jaywink/fosdem)

comment.body:
Sure, the person icon we should use is [this one](https://fonts.google.com/icons?icon.style=Rounded&icon.query=account&icon.set=Material+Symbols&selected=Material+Symbols+Rounded:person:FILL@0;wght@400;GRAD@0;opsz@24) from Material, which has been added to Figma [here](https://www.figma.com/file/gkNXqPoiJhEv2wt0EJpew4/Compound-Icons?type=design&node-id=2715%3A5513&mode=design&t=XhHZhYzMGyen6bHR-1).

I'd recommend the outline icon as linked, not the solid one.
It makes more sense if the input is generic rather than just string

pull_request.title: Add script to generate mermaid graph of automations
pull_request.body:
Requires https://github.com/vector-im/element-web/pull/26426
Fixes https://github.com/vector-im/element-web/issues/26424

Example of what it generated: https://gist.github.com/t3chguy/db4750121ebabac5274a05e9f83701bb

It is not perfect, we might want to find something which lays out more responsively than Mermaid.

<!-- CHANGELOG_PREVIEW_START -->
---
This change is marked as an *internal change* (Task), so will not be included in the changelog.<!-- CHANGELOG_PREVIEW_END -->

issue.title: Use a person outline instead of G for the guest icon in the top-left user menu

labels.name: X-Needs-Product
labels.description: More input needed from the Product team

labels.name: T-Enhancement
labels.description: New features, changes in functionality, performance boosts, user-facing improvements

labels.name: Z-FOSDEM
labels.description: Issues in chat.fosdem.org

issue.body:
### Your use case

#### What would you like to do?
As a guest, I would like to see a person outline instead of a G for my avatar

#### Why would you like to do it?
I have no personal association with the letter G and it feels like it's not me when I see it

#### How would you like to achieve it?
[Here is our branch from a previous FOSDEM which includes the change](https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-react-sdk/commits/jaywink/fosdem)

comment.body:
> My initial thought is to challenge whether this is actually a problem. I understand that G might not feel like you, but you are also on a guest account so maybe there shouldn't be an expectation for it to.

I was tracing this line of thinking too asking myself if there was healthy friction around the initialism being a visual wart— as users have a better experience when they have an actual account, it's a motivator to create one.

But, on balance, I think the fact we just have a giant G in an icon as the default out of the box experience is just abstract, so my bias is an icon would be better. What did we decide on in Element X? I can't find it easily in Figma.

> Which one though would take a bit of thinking as I'd need to explore which icon is best and most easily understood to communicate guest.

A person/profile icon would suit? E.g. Here's Messages with an unknown number:

![IMG_8421](https://github.com/vector-im/element-web/assets/4626865/7a0bb04f-f275-4900-bc46-ebdb7b721c06)

issue.title: Use a person outline instead of G for the guest icon in the top-left user menu

labels.name: X-Needs-Product
labels.description: More input needed from the Product team

labels.name: T-Enhancement
labels.description: New features, changes in functionality, performance boosts, user-facing improvements

labels.name: Z-FOSDEM
labels.description: Issues in chat.fosdem.org

issue.body:
### Your use case

#### What would you like to do?
As a guest, I would like to see a person outline instead of a G for my avatar

#### Why would you like to do it?
I have no personal association with the letter G and it feels like it's not me when I see it

#### How would you like to achieve it?
[Here is our branch from a previous FOSDEM which includes the change](https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-react-sdk/commits/jaywink/fosdem)

comment.body:
Okay I understand.

My initial thought is to challenge whether this is actually a problem. I understand that G might not feel like you, but you are also on a guest account so maybe there shouldn't be an expectation for it to. Is it important to see from the avatar that another user is on a guest account?

If though this is something that we need to add, I would suggest using an icon. Which one though would take a bit of thinking as I'd need to explore which icon is best and most easily understood to communicate guest.

issue.title: Can not share full screen in Ubuntu (Wayland)

labels.name: T-Defect
labels.description: Something isn't working: bugs, crashes, hangs and other reported problems

labels.name: X-Community-Supported-Platform
labels.description: This issue occurs in a platform not directly supported by us, but by a community project elsewhere

issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

When I try to share entire screen, it is shared, but it is blank (black, actually). However, I can share application windows (but I am not sure if I can share all applications).

It seems it is a problem with Wayland screen sharing support. I have read that WebRTC should build with the enabled `rtc_use_pipewire` flag, maybe this is the issue here?

Also, this bug could be related: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=682122

### Outcome

#### What did you expect?
That screen sharing works

#### What happened instead?
Shared screen was blank.

### Operating system

Ubuntu 23.04

### Application version

Element version: 1.11.46 Olm version: 3.2.14

### How did you install the app?

Through Snap.

### Homeserver

matrix.org

### Will you send logs?

No

comment.body:
> OK, but why then sharing application windows is working

Electron/Chromium likely uses different APIs for those which are sandboxed differently - at the Web level they use the same API. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaDevices/getDisplayMedia / https://www.electronjs.org/docs/latest/api/desktop-capturer / https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaDevices/getUserMedia

OK, but why then sharing application windows is working (just full screen is not)?

Anyway, I will check with the snap packager also.

issue.title: Can not share full screen in Ubuntu (Wayland)

labels.name: T-Defect
labels.description: Something isn't working: bugs, crashes, hangs and other reported problems

labels.name: X-Community-Supported-Platform
labels.description: This issue occurs in a platform not directly supported by us, but by a community project elsewhere

issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

When I try to share entire screen, it is shared, but it is blank (black, actually). However, I can share application windows (but I am not sure if I can share all applications).

It seems it is a problem with Wayland screen sharing support. I have read that WebRTC should build with the enabled `rtc_use_pipewire` flag, maybe this is the issue here?

Also, this bug could be related: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=682122

### Outcome

#### What did you expect?
That screen sharing works

#### What happened instead?
Shared screen was blank.

### Operating system

Ubuntu 23.04

### Application version

Element version: 1.11.46 Olm version: 3.2.14

### How did you install the app?

Through Snap.

### Homeserver

matrix.org

### Will you send logs?

No

comment.body:
@MatejKovacic where instead they should probably be using the snap output of https://www.electron.build/ - Snaps are not the same as just running a binary.

> Without custom flags at installation, or subsequent [interface connections](https://snapcraft.io/docs/interface-management), snaps are confined to a restrictive security sandbox with no access to system resources outside of the snap.

issue.title: Can not share full screen in Ubuntu (Wayland)

labels.name: T-Defect
labels.description: Something isn't working: bugs, crashes, hangs and other reported problems

labels.name: X-Community-Supported-Platform
labels.description: This issue occurs in a platform not directly supported by us, but by a community project elsewhere

issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

When I try to share entire screen, it is shared, but it is blank (black, actually). However, I can share application windows (but I am not sure if I can share all applications).

It seems it is a problem with Wayland screen sharing support. I have read that WebRTC should build with the enabled `rtc_use_pipewire` flag, maybe this is the issue here?

Also, this bug could be related: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=682122

### Outcome

#### What did you expect?
That screen sharing works

#### What happened instead?
Shared screen was blank.

### Operating system

Ubuntu 23.04

### Application version

Element version: 1.11.46 Olm version: 3.2.14

### How did you install the app?

Through Snap.

### Homeserver

matrix.org

### Will you send logs?

No

comment.body:
No.

Snap maintainer is basically [ingesting the latest deb directly from upstream and bundling it in a snap](https://github.com/kenvandine/element-desktop/blob/3b91c25833950f3d3c49c46e0049d8f3bb263256/README.md#element-desktop). So it is no related to some Snap problem.

issue.title: "Sign in instead" is not a link in non-english version

labels.name: T-Defect
labels.description: Something isn't working: bugs, crashes, hangs and other reported problems

issue.body: ### Steps to reproduce 1. Where are you starting? What can you see? 2. What do you click? Go to "Register" page, in a non-english language. At the bottom of the page, try clicking "Sign in instead" (e.g. "Se connecter à la place") ### Outcome #### What did you expect? Clicking link goes to sign in #### What happened instead? it's not a link, I can't click it ### Operating system _No response_ ### Browser information _No response_ ### URL for webapp app.element.io ### Application version 1.11.47 ### Homeserver _No response_ ### Will you send logs? No

issue.title: Properly support multiple tabs

labels.name: T-Enhancement
labels.description: New features, changes in functionality, performance boosts, user-facing improvements

issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. I'm using an EMS-hosted element web 1.11.42
2. As usual, I opened a second tab to go to the element URL in order to handle a coding related manner while keeping an eye on an organizational space, and participating in a documentation-related discussion



### Outcome

#### What did you expect?

Second tab works, as it always used to – after all, having more than one window open is a very classical power-user workflow

#### What happened instead?

![image](https://github.com/vector-im/element-web/assets/958972/903ec636-aa68-4be7-9f6f-f821b0274640)

I got a message 

> Element is open in another window. Click "Continue" to use Element here and disconnect the other window.

and that's more than annoying. This makes element worse to use than a significant part of the competition, which we decided against a while back.

### Operating system

Linux x86_64

### Browser information

FF 117.0.1

### URL for webapp

chat.gnuradio.org

### Application version

Element version: 1.11.42 Olm version: 3.2.14

### Homeserver

https://gnuradio.ems.host

### Will you send logs?

No

comment.body:
> I wonder if it's a privacy concern that Element can detect other instances of it running in different containers.

If that were really what's happening, it would be a concern for everything to do with container tabs, and you'd need to take it up with Mozilla. But I very much doubt that is what is happening: either you actually have a second instance running in the same container, or you're seeing some other bug where the lock is not being correctly cleared on reload.

It's likely that https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-react-sdk/pull/11800 will help with this once it is released; if not, please open a separate issue and submit logs from within the app (they are still useful even if you have to reload).

issue.title: Use a person outline instead of G for the guest icon in the top-left user menu

labels.name: X-Needs-Product
labels.description: More input needed from the Product team

labels.name: T-Enhancement
labels.description: New features, changes in functionality, performance boosts, user-facing improvements

labels.name: Z-FOSDEM
labels.description: Issues in chat.fosdem.org

issue.body:
### Your use case

#### What would you like to do?
As a guest, I would like to see a person outline instead of a G for my avatar

#### Why would you like to do it?
I have no personal association with the letter G and it feels like it's not me when I see it

#### How would you like to achieve it?
[Here is our branch from a previous FOSDEM which includes the change](https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-react-sdk/commits/jaywink/fosdem)

comment.body:
In our case, some people attend the conference or lurk without registering an account.

For registered users, I think it's good to be shown the first letter of their username, it helps differentiate DMs more readily in the left panel and there is a personal association with the letter

issue.title: Element-R: include crypto info in rageshakes and sentry

labels.name: T-Task
labels.description: Refactoring, enabling or disabling functionality, other engineering tasks

labels.name: A-Element-R
labels.description: Issues affecting the port of Element's crypto layer to Rust

issue.body: https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-react-sdk/pull/10081 hacked out the crypto magic for rageshakes. Let's wire it back in.

issue.title: Use a person outline instead of G for the guest icon in the top-left user menu

labels.name: X-Needs-Product
labels.description: More input needed from the Product team

labels.name: T-Enhancement
labels.description: New features, changes in functionality, performance boosts, user-facing improvements

labels.name: Z-FOSDEM
labels.description: Issues in chat.fosdem.org

issue.body:
### Your use case

#### What would you like to do?
As a guest, I would like to see a person outline instead of a G for my avatar

#### Why would you like to do it?
I have no personal association with the letter G and it feels like it's not me when I see it

#### How would you like to achieve it?
[Here is our branch from a previous FOSDEM which includes the change](https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-react-sdk/commits/jaywink/fosdem)

comment.body: Whenever they don't have an account, like following a link into a Matrix room for the very first time ever

issue.title: Use a person outline instead of G for the guest icon in the top-left user menu

labels.name: X-Needs-Product
labels.description: More input needed from the Product team

labels.name: T-Enhancement
labels.description: New features, changes in functionality, performance boosts, user-facing improvements

labels.name: Z-FOSDEM
labels.description: Issues in chat.fosdem.org

issue.body:
### Your use case

#### What would you like to do?
As a guest, I would like to see a person outline instead of a G for my avatar

#### Why would you like to do it?
I have no personal association with the letter G and it feels like it's not me when I see it

#### How would you like to achieve it?
[Here is our branch from a previous FOSDEM which includes the change](https://github.com/matrix-org/matrix-react-sdk/commits/jaywink/fosdem)

comment.body:
Okay I see it. 

When would a guest account be used by someone? If it's an edge case I don't see an issue with keeping the G. My concern is that adding a specific solution for this (a user icon for example) might add confusion.
